title: Oxfordshire Live: Thursday 25 August - BBC News
summary: search on for least favourite english word .
dredd publisher buys roy of the rovers .
fifty firefighters tackle eynsham industrial estate blaze .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading today .
join us again from 08:00 tomorrow for news , sport , weather and travel from around oxfordshire .

documents.title: hare coursing reported near wallingford
text: police have recieved reports of hare coursing near wallingford and towards swyncombe by suspects using a green/grey subaru with a number plate beginning wg .
they are appealing for people to call them if they see the car .

documents.title: heavy traffic in both directions on botley road
text: if you are coming into oxford this evening , probably best to avoid botley road # roadworks # jams @ twitterid
is cutteslowe roundabout also closed tonight .
that nimmo-smith hates people does n't he .

documents.title: breakingpolice and firefighters called after sexual assault
text: officers were called to reports that a 29-year-old woman had been sexually assaulted in a footpath off manor road , south hinksey , at 08:00 .
a man approached and grabbed the woman , who sustained minor injuries .
the fire service was called this afternoon to retrieve an item from a tree in connection with the investigation .
the suspect is a slim white man , who is clean shaven , about 5ft 9ins , between 14 and 20 years old .
he was wearing dark blue jeans and a grey top with red sleeves .

documents.title: nursery told to pay £ 6,740 for mouse infestation in kitchen
text: a children 's nursery in marcham was ordered to pay a fine and costs totaling £ 6,740 after an inspection found mouse droppings in their kitchen .
helen scott-corcoran and kaye merriman of marcham little angels pleaded guilty to three breaches of food safety and hygiene regulations on 15 august at oxford magistrates ' court .
vale of white horse district council found evidence of mouse activity at the nursery during a routine food inspection on 19 october 2015 .

the kitchen , which was used to prepare food and drink served to babies and young children , was in a filthy condition with a build-up of dirt , gnawed materials , and a large amount of mouse droppings both in the kitchen and where children could access them in the nursery .

since the incident , the nursery has put in place a pest control contract , has been thoroughly cleaned and pest-proofed , and there are food safety management procedures in place complete with staff training .

documents.title: oxford care home flooded by burst water main
text: firefighters were called to flooding in the plant room of marston court care home in oxford at 05:09 on thursday 25 august 2016 .
on arrival it became apparent that water was entering the care home from a burst water main located in an adjacent street .
firefighters diverted the torrent of water away from the care home and neighbouring properties using polythene water filled booms , and the care home was able to stay open .

documents.title: st hugh 's college from the air
text: st hugh 's college , which claims notable alumni theresa may and aung san suu kyi , has produced this new video to show off the college grounds from the air .

documents.title: thumbs up for ledson signing
text: the bbc 's chief football writer phil mcnulty is impressed with oxford united 's new signing from everton .
@ twitterid have completed a smart piece of business signing youngster @ twitterid from everton .

documents.title: the joy of going home
text: a story that has to put a smile on your face .
oxfordshire animal sanctuary has posted this of maisey - a four-year resident - who has finally found her forever home .
after four years with us , gorgeous maisey has finally left to start a wonderful life with her new family .
a firm favourite among staff and supporters ; this cheeky little lady will be greatly missed but is wished only happiness .

documents.title: oxford secure deal for everton 's ledson
text: ledson , 19 , made one senior appearance for the toffees in the europa league against fk krasnodar in 2014 and has been capped by england under-19s .

documents.title: co-op store in long hanborough targeted by robbers
text: police are appealing for help after a co-op store in long hanborough was raided - the second co-op store to be targeted by thieves in the last week .
at about 03:00 a land rover defender parked outside the co-op in main road .
at least two offenders tried unsuccessfully to take the cash machine from the store .
the offenders then set land rover on fire and left in two other vehicles .
there are no descriptions of the two vehicles or the offenders .
last saturday , masked men made an `` audacious '' ram raid on a cash machine in the co-op store in milton-under-wychwood .
thames valley police are not linking the two incidents at present .

documents.title: 'moist ' leads world 's worst word poll
text: the distasteful adjective - a favourite of great british bake off presenting duo mel and sue - has topped polls in the uk , us and canada , according to those behind the global survey .

documents.title: council 'signed off defective roof '
text: christopher harris had a new roof built on his home in charlton-on-otmoor but within months found it was leaking .

documents.title: police suspect 'sexually motivated ' on woman in south hinksey
text: police say an attack on a woman in south hinksey this morning may have been sexually motivated .
officers were called at 08:01 to manor road to reports that a woman had been attacked .
the offender , a man , had left the scene and the victim had sustained minor injuries .
an investigation is under way and the victim is being supported by specially trained officers .
we are in the very early stages of the investigation and the victim is speaking to officers at this time to establish the circumstances of the incident .
at this time it is not known exactly what took place , however we suspect that the attack was sexually motivated .

documents.title: oxford united : appleton confident of late signings
text: oxford united head coach michael appleton says he 's confident of bringing a couple more players to the club , but says the deals might be done during the closing stages of the transfer window .
clubs in the football league and premier league have seven days left to complete their business before the window closes .

documents.title: plan to fill £ 17m health budget black hole to be discussed
text: plans to fill a £ 17m black hole in the finances of the body which oversees oxfordshire 's health service will be discussed at a meeting this morning .
using money for winter peaks in demand , postponing investment in gp projects and reducing how much is spent on some types of prescriptions , is being proposed .
the board of oxfordshire clinical commissioning group will be asked to approve the plan .

it follows a 40 % increase in the weekly rate paid towards nursing care , which comes on top of larger than expected contracts with the trusts that run the john radcliffe hospital and provide mental health services across the county .

documents.title: dredd publisher buys roy of the rovers
text: oxford-based rebellion said it is the biggest deal of its kind in 30 years and could bring `` long-vanished '' classic comics back into print .

documents.title: volunteers wanted for 100,000 genome project
text: doctors in oxford are looking for new volunteers to help improve the treatment of rare diseases and cancers .
more than 1,000 patients and their families have already contributed to the 100,000 genome project since it started a year ago .
two-year-old evie kirk from chinnor has an immune deficiency and provided dna samples , along with her parents and kevin and corinne .

if we can pinpoint which gene is affected the doctors will be able to better predict what this will mean for evie 's future , from the risks involved in having her own children to whether this will mean she is more at risk from developing more serious diseases or cancers .

documents.title: staff shortages raise fears of early closure for oxfordshire 's children 's centres
text: under-threat children 's centres across oxfordshire could close earlier than expected due to an exodus of staff .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: search on for least favourite english word
text: `` moist '' , `` no '' and `` like '' are early front runners to be named the least favourite word in the english language .
an online survey by oxford dictionaries is asking people around the world to submit their language gripes , as part of wider research into the use of english .
onewordmap aims to be a platform to profile public opinion on any language-related question , and display the results in a publicly available database to allow for independent research .
nearly 10,000 people have already got involved , with `` moist '' topping the list in the uk , us and canada , while `` no '' tops the poll in germany and the netherlands .

documents.title: weather : a little cloudier than yesterday , with showers developing
text: it 'll be cloudier and less hot than wednesday , with showery rain and some thunder possible later this afternoon and into the evening .
some brighter spells are likely throughout the day though .
highs of 26c ( 79f ) .

documents.title: travel latest : burst water main and traffic light failure
text: get up-to-the minute details on these incidents , and the rest of the county 's travel news on the bbc travel site or follow @ bbcoxtravel .
caution : # abingdon # b4017 - traffic lights still out of action on the # drayton road at the preston road junction .
reports that # b4150 # marston road closed in both directions due to a burst water main btwn # a420 # headington rd and # b4495 # headleyway .

documents.title: fifty firefighters tackle eynsham industrial estate blaze
text: fifty firefighters from two counties have tackled a large fire at an industrial estate in oxfordshire .
emergency calls were made at 17:24 on wednesday to the blaze at oakfield industrial estate in eynsham .
crews from oxfordshire and warwickshire worked in `` extremely hot and arduous conditions '' to stop the fire spreading .
an investigation into the cause of the blaze at the home of oxford monitoring solutions will continue today .

documents.title: hello and good morning
text: welcome to thursday 's local live page for oxfordshire .
as always let us know what 's happening in your area via email , facebook or twitter .
